pcd.data

Class ImageDataObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcd.data.ImageDataObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ImageDataObject
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Author:
    Tibor Sloboda Stores data pertaining to images and points on these images, denoting the cilia coordinates within it.
    See Also:
    PcdPoint, ImageDataStorage, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isAngleInitialized

        public boolean isAngleInitialized()
        Checks if angles have been initialized
        Returns:
        True if initialized

      • angleInitialize

        public void angleInitialize(double avg,
                            int count)
        Initializes the angle properties of the image based on the data. If count is 0 or if angles are already initialized, it ends, otherwise it sets angleInitialized to true. This is mostly just a helper function and the arguments are passed to setAvgStdAngle(double, int) for processing.
        Parameters:
        avg - The average of normalized cilia angles
        count - The number of non-negative cilia angles
        See Also:
        ImageDataStorage.initializeAngles()

      • setAngleInitialized

        public void setAngleInitialized(boolean val)
        Parameters:
        val - New boolean to set angleInitialized to

      • getAvgAngle

        public double getAvgAngle()
        Returns:
        The value of avgAngle

      • getStdAngle

        public double getStdAngle()
        Returns:
        The value of stdAngle

      • setAvgAngle

        public void setAvgAngle(double avgAngle)
        Parameters:
        avgAngle - Double parameter to update avgAngle to

      • setStdAngle

        public void setStdAngle(double stdAngle)
        Parameters:
        stdAngle - Double parameter to update stdAngle to

      • setAvgStdAngle

        public void setAvgStdAngle(double avgAngle,
                           int positiveCount)
        This method is used to update the standard deviation of angles based on normalized angles and the average of normalized angles.
        Parameters:
        avgAngle - The normalized average of angles
        positiveCount - The number of non-negative angles

      • updateAvgStdAngle

        public void updateAvgStdAngle()
        Updates the average of the statistical sample of the image object. It is complementary to setAvgStdAngle(double, int) in that it calculates the number of positive angles and the normalized average as well. This is done using existing points so it only works when initialized.

        The standard deviation is then calculated using these in setAvgStdAngle(double, int)

      • initialize

        public void initialize(ArrayList<PcdPoint> pointlist,
                       ArrayList<Integer> typeIdentifierList,
                       ArrayList<String> typeIconList,
                       ArrayList<String> typeConfigList)
        Initializes the ImageDataObject with points from the Python process. It filters the points using the point filtering utility before saving them to pointList .. It also instantiates PointOverlay using the initializeOverlay(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>) method which is then used to draw the points over the image.

        Prevents initialization if the size of the point list exceeds theoretical maximum of around 4876 based on Python filtering mechanism to prevent exploitation and hanging of the software

        Parameters:
        pointlist - An ArrayList of PcdPoint
        typeIdentifierList - Contains the cilia type IDs
        typeIconList - Optional list of paths to icon to be used to draw points
        typeConfigList - List of type names for the cilia

      • initializeOverlay

        public void initializeOverlay(ArrayList<Integer> typeIdentifierList,
                              ArrayList<String> typeIconList)
        Initializes the PointOverlay to draw points on the image.
        Parameters:
        typeIdentifierList - The list of cilia type IDs
        typeIconList - Optional (can be empty) list of paths to icon to be used as points

      • loadImage

        public BufferedImage loadImage()
        Loads the associated image, and resizes it if needed.
        Returns:
        The BufferedImage or null if failed to load

      • getOverlay

        public PointOverlay getOverlay()
        Returns instantiated drawing layer for points or null if not instantiated
        Returns:
        The instantiated layer or null

      • fileMatch

        public boolean fileMatch(String path)
                  throws IOException
        Checks if passed file is the same file as the image associated with this object.
        Parameters:
        path - A String path to the file
        Returns:
        True if the files match
        Throws:
        IOException - when the software doesn't have access privileges to check if files match

      • getClosestPoint

        public PcdPoint getClosestPoint(int x,
                                int y)
        Find the closest point to a coordinate
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        the closest point from pointList or null

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Returns:
        True if image object is initialized

      • setPointsOpacity

        public void setPointsOpacity(float f)
        Updates the opacity value of layer and re-draws it.
        Parameters:
        f - The opacity, between 0 and 1 (corresponds to 0-100%)

      • addPoint

        protected void addPoint(PcdPoint pcdPoint)
        Adds a new PcdPoint to the list of points for the image object. Prevents adding a new point if the current amount exceeds 400. Also redraws layer once added to show newly added point.
        Parameters:
        pcdPoint - The point to be added

      • setPointList

        public void setPointList(ArrayList<PcdPoint> points)
        Replaces the current list of points with a new one. Doesn't do anything if passed list exceeds a size of 400.
        Parameters:
        points - An ArrayList of PcdPoint

      • getImageName

        public String getImageName()
        Gets the name of the image based on the path to the file
        Returns:
        name of the image file

      • getImgPath

        public String getImgPath()
        Returns the path to the image associated with the image object
        Returns:
        a String path to the image

      • getPointTypes

        public ArrayList<Integer> getPointTypes()
        Returns the index-bound list of the IDs of cilia types associated to points
        Returns:
        a ArrayList of Integer of the IDs of PcdPoint in pointList

      • getPointList

        public final List<PcdPoint> getPointList()
        Returns the list of points.

        This breaks encapsulation but data contained inside pointList is not sensitive and corruption of this data will not harm the software.

        It is additionally overflow protected by checking the size of the list, so that the application doesn't freeze attempting to draw and load all points into tables.

        Returns:
        A reference to pointList or null if too many points present

      • loadImage

        protected BufferedImage loadImage(String imgPath)
        Updates the associated image path and loads it.
        Parameters:
        imgPath - A String path to the image
        Returns:
        The loaded BufferedImage
